Issues.Title: The "span multiple rows or columns" and "align a control" links are not working in the DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, it doesn't work in .Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo due to the https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/10213

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, open the Column and Row Styles dialog of TableLayoutPanel control, observe the "span multiple rows or columns" and "align a control" links

### Steps to reproduce

**Actual results in [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app:**
Issue1: The **"s"** and **"a"** characters is not covered by links
Issue2: The span multiple rows or columns" and "align a control" links is not working 
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/3d90cd56-33f6-4016-bb9c-c5ed544997e1)
![ActualResults](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/20c8db42-9641-476f-85e0-9cb1d4d013b3)

**Expected results:**
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/ffaa7a1e-d73a-420e-ae4f-c53af7a8aa15)
![ExpectedResults](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/d533e118-3291-45e3-97f7-7cc45431a07e)

**Steps to reproduce:**
Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "The "span multiple rows or columns" and "align a control" links are not working in the DemoConsole application" (#11638)

Issues.Title: missing support for complex DataBinding
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2022 (64-Bit) - Preview, Version 17.11.0 Preview 2.1, german language pack

### .NET version

.NET 7, .NET 8

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

not in .NET
only in .NET Framework, e.g. 4.8.1

### Issue description

If I want to use complex DataBinding for ListBoxes or ComboBoxes, I miss the options to select valid possibilities/properties via the smarttag internal ComboBoxes. I have to input the names of the properties manually. Even worse: The property »selected value« can't be used at all. I have to add a databinding code line into the FormX.Designer.VB by myself.
![DesignerIssue](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/49878115/c089a59f-76ff-4d4a-a6e6-e13f2095b95e)

### Steps to reproduce

1. create a new WinForms project, either with C# or VB.NET
2. open the designer of the only existing form
3. add a ListBox (LB) or a ComboBox (CB) to the form
4. select the LB/CB and click on the [>] to open the smart tag/advanced control options
5. activate »use data bound items«
6. You see just one combobox to select the datasource for the LB/CB. The next three boxes below are just textboxes, which can't be used like the comboboxes in the .NET framework designer to select the databinding-properties of the selected datasource.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "missing support for complex DataBinding" (#11616)

Issues.Title: Unable to switch the tabs using mouse. Only switching the tab can be done through TabKey navigation at DesignTime
Issues.Body:
### Environment

Edition - Windows 11 Enterprise
Version - 23H2
OS build - 22631.3737
Visual Studio version - 17.9.2

### .NET version

.Netcore 6,7,8

### Did this work in a previous version of Visual Studio and/or previous .NET release?

No, it doesn't work on previous NetCore versions.

### Issue description

I'm trying to switch the tabs by using the mouse click at DesignTime but can't be able to switch. But can be able to be switching by using the TabKey.
For your reference, I have attached a simple sample that replicates the issue.
[CustomTabControl_Sample.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16142154/CustomTabControl_Sample.zip)


### Steps to reproduce

1.Switch the tabs by using the TabKey.
2.Switch the tabs by using the mouse.

Expected Behavior: While switch using the mouse, the selected tab needs to be switched.
Observed Behavior: No tab switches happened.

### Diagnostics

_No response_
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Unable to switch the tabs using mouse. Only switching the tab can be done through TabKey navigation at DesignTime" (#11642)

Issues.Title: System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when click the help button in TreeView smarttag in the DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0: Main branch of Winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it has different behavior. In .Net 8.0 from Release/8.0 branch of Winforms repo, no response after clicking the help button in TreeView smarttag in the DemoConsole application.

**More info:**
This issue also repro in propertygrid control binding the TreeView.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/df4ed32c-d39d-41c5-89c0-cd27ea27ed2b)

[StackTrace.txt](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/16141431/StackTrace.txt)

### Issue description

Actual result in [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app:
System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when click the help button in TreeView smarttag in the DemoConsole application.

**Call Stack:**
System.NullReferenceException
  HResult=0x80004003
  Message=Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
  Source=System.Windows.Forms.Design
  StackTrace:
   at System.Windows.Forms.Design.TreeNodeCollectionEditor.TreeNodeCollectionForm.TreeNodeCollectionEditor_HelpButtonClicked(Object sender, CancelEventArgs e) in C:\Users\v-melonwang\Desktop\New folder\winforms\src\System.Windows.Forms.Design\src\System\Windows\Forms\Design\TreeNodeCollectionEditor.cs:line 705


![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/fea209f7-8148-4c04-8320-5c6f5e8c641a)

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/faf16a1c-d8a7-4968-8681-9f1420acf49b

Expected result: 
The [TreeNode Editor MSDN](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/previous-versions/visualstudio/visual-studio-2010/shx04ftk(v=vs.100)?devlangs=csharp&f1url=%3FappId%3DDev17IDEF1%26l%3DEN-US%26k%3Dk(net.ComponentModel.TreeNodeCollectionEditor)%3Bk(DevLang-csharp)%26rd%3Dtrue) should open in broswer when click he help button in TreeView smarttag.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/94418985/3149e945-ddaf-4546-b053-47e9a749aa0f



### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "System.NullReferenceException: 'Object reference not set to an instance of an object.' occurs when click the help button in TreeView smarttag in the DemoConsole application" (#11640)

Issues.Title: TrackBar visually breaks with certain changes to certain properties
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.NET 7

### Issue description

While working on our app, we noticed there is something wrong with the default Winforms TrackBar control. Recently we updated the app to build with .NET 8 and I created a simple Winforms app to confirm this.
There seems to be some visual issue with TrackBar's ticks.  I also noticed there is some threshold (percentage of Width to Size/TickFrequency) where it visually breaks. I picked one combination of the properties that is easily reproducible.

![TrackBar_issue](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/36231478/f0b9c958-8950-4eb5-97ac-9097aa6997c5)

I can't reproduce the issue when building the project with .NET 7. 
The same issue happens when creating the controls programmatically with the specified properties.

### Steps to reproduce

- Create a new Winforms App
- Add a TrackBar (from Toolbox) onto the Surface
- Change Width property to 100
- Change Maximum property to 51
- Change TickFrequency property to 10
- Run the App (The TrackBar looks correct while designing, it breaks during runtime)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "TrackBar visually breaks with certain changes to certain properties" (#11639)

Issues.Title: [dnceng-bot] Branch `winforms/release/8.0` can't be merged to Azdo internal branch
Issues.Body:
Branch [release/8.0](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/commits/release/8.0/) in `dotnet/winforms` repo can't be mirrored from GitHub to Azure [internal/release/8.0](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-winforms?version=GBinternal%2Frelease%2F8.0&_a=history) via internal merge. 

There are conflicting commits in the target branch.
The branch is configured to be mirrored via automated merge. 
The situation is rare but normal. The target branch is expected to receive manual commits in the Azure DevOps clone, which could cause conflict.

Conflicts need to be **resolved to unblock the code flow**.

- you can resolve the issue by resolving the conflict in the **target branch only**. 
    - Please make sure that the changes sensitive from security perspective are not published ahead of time to GitHub!
- reverting the extra commits in the Azdo target branch.
- checking the logs of the mirroring process in the [mirroring pipeline](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_build?definitionId=1387).
- you can disable the mirroring of the branch in the [configuration file](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-mirroring?path=/dnceng-subscriptions.jsonc).
- you can ask @dotnet/dnceng for help or read the [documentation](https://dev.azure.com/dnceng/internal/_git/dotnet-mirroring?path=/README.md).

Please close this issue once the conflict is resolved.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[dnceng-bot] Branch `winforms/release/8.0` can't be merged to Azdo internal branch" (#11637)

Issues.Title: Hope to provide the ability to customize the title bar
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

Hope to provide the ability to customize the title bar
希望能提供自定义标题栏的功能

Currently in uwp or winui 3, all the corresponding window class contains a extendscontentintotitlebar properties, can be hidden by default title bar, and a custom title bar, want to ask winform will consider such function? If not, there is no corresponding win32 api to implement such functionality
目前在 uwp 或 winui 3 中，都在对应的 window 类中包含一个 extendscontentintotitlebar 的属性，可以隐藏默认的标题栏，并自定义标题栏，想问一下 winform 以后会考虑这样的功能吗？如果没有，有没有相应的 win32 api来实现这样的功能?

reference link:https://learn.microsoft.com/zh-cn/windows/apps/develop/title-bar

### API Proposal

```csharp
namespace System.Windows.Forms;

public class Form
{
    public bool ExtendsContentIntoTitlebar { get; set; }
}
```


### API Usage

NONE

### Alternative Designs

NONE

### Risks

NONE

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

Yes
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Hope to provide the ability to customize the title bar" (#11633)

Issues.Title: Error while running test application on winforms repo
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

Latest winforms repo

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it cannot repro in last week .NET 9.0 E2E testing on winforms repo

### Issue description

Clone winforms repo then use start-vs.cmd, cmd output Build succeded, but running WinformsControlsTest app has error

Actual result:
Error while running WinformsControlsTest app
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/108860782/6f84bec0-c32d-41d0-8589-2617e63e3408)
Expected result:
Run WinformsControlsTest app successfully with no error

### Steps to reproduce

1. Clone winforms repo: https://github.com/dotnet/winforms.git
2. Run WinformsControlsTest app
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Error while running test application on winforms repo " (#11629)

Issues.Title: Undo fails to restore deleted TabControl in TableLayoutPanel in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0: Main branch of WinForms repo (.NET 9.0.100-preview.7.24353.17)

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, this is a regression issue. Not repro on .NET 9.0.0-preview.5.24306.7

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, undo process of deleting TableLayoutPanel contained TabControl does not work properly. TabControl disappears after clicking Undo a few times

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/156630333/16d261c4-e642-46bb-a48a-8abd9f0d310f





### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo

## More Info

1. The issue cannot be reproduced when other controls are in the TableLayoutPanel.
2. When moving controls within TableLayoutPanel and using undo, it takes up to 3 clicks to restore the original state.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/156630333/bd7875a6-5189-4776-a27b-d1a4f850eb6b

3. Reproduce the same result when using Ctrl+Z to undo.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Undo fails to restore deleted TabControl in TableLayoutPanel in DemoConsole application" (#11628)

Issues.Title: BinaryFormatter error when Copy/Cut/Paste menu item in DemoConsole application
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0: Main branch

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

n/a

### Issue description

In [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) test app of Winforms repo, BinaryFormatter error when clicking `Copy`/`Cut`/`Paste` commands for Menu Item.

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/2433737/9c968b5f-88c0-4ef3-afc0-3195344b752c)


### Steps to reproduce

Test sample: [DemoConsole](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/tree/main/src/System.Windows.Forms/tests/IntegrationTests/DesignSurface/DemoConsole) in Winforms repo

Related: #6267 / #6269
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "BinaryFormatter error when Copy/Cut/Paste menu item in DemoConsole application" (#11617)
